reviewText: It was great seeing the gang together and in the olympic games.  It wasn't as tricky to guess who the villian was but, still great fun and exciting to watch.  Love watching the crazy olympics with all the other cartoon characters.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Warner Bros. is on a mission to release every piece of Scooby-Doo film it owns. They put out a new animated full-length movie every six months to a year now. The time is here for "Scooby-Doo! Laff-A-Lympics: Spooky Games" to arrive for classic cartoon fans of the crime-solving canine. Not only do Mystery, Inc. enthusiasts get 12 original episodes of the series, but there's a brand new one entitled "Spooky Games" included.This collection has the Scooby Doobies in competition with the Yogi Yahooeys and the Really Rottens in international races and events that take place in France, Australia, Hawaii, Norway, Japan, and many other exotic locations. Star-studded contests pit everyone from Captain Caveman, Fred Flintstone, Jabberjaw, and Huckleberry Hound to Dread Baron, Mumbly, and Mrs. Creepley against each other."Spooky Games" only features the Scooby Gang. They find themselves investigating a 1,000 year old statue which came to life. It's intent on ruining the World Invitational Games where Shaggy is a contestant in a race.The classic episodes from the late 1970s will bring back memories for parents watching them with their kids. They'll remember watching this after school every day. It's Hanna-Barbera fun at its best. How can you go wrong with so many beloved characters in one show?"Spooky Games" resembles "What's New, Scooby-Doo!" more than the newer "Scooby-Doo! Mystery Incorporated." All the action doesn't take place in Crystal Cove. This puts the gang back on the road solving mysteries. It fits in better with the full-length animated films."Scooby-Doo! Laff-A-Lympics: Spooky Games" will please old and new fans of the mystery solving gang. It features globe-trotting adventures that involve several of the greatest cartoon characters of the 1960s and 1970s. Add a brand new episode to the mix and you have hilarious entertainment for the whole family.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this because i like scooby doo cartoons & laff-a-lympics as well.  I bought the first & the second volumes so i wanted to see them.  If you get this be warned that it does show a couple of duplicates of cartoons from volumes one & two.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This dvd includes Scooby and Shaggy and more funny characters like Hokey wolf, Mumbly, and Dynomutt. All of these goofy characters compete on three teams (  Scooby Doobies, Yogi Yahooes, and really rottens) in the olympics. The team captains on these teams is obviously Scooby on the doobie, yogi on the yahooes, and Mumbly on the rottens. There is also a special on this dvd called Spooky games. It is kind of obvious, but it is still good.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Brings back some memories, interesting show.  Unfortunately the Olympic theme is great for a show or two but after that it is a lot of the same which gets a little old.  Kids liked but had same feeling.  Who is this for...the scooby fanatic that wants them all.  Who's it not for....someone who wants good entertainment cartoons

reviewText: Grew up watching the Laff A Lympics. What a great treat to see it out on DVD. Lets hope we get all the episodes on DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewText: My daughter was EXTREMELY excited to see there was another Scooby-Doo title she wasn't aware of. So, I just had to buy it of course. Best thing about this one is there's a few new games on it. So, you get 2 discs and on the first disc is a new Olympic Games movie then you only get about 3 new Laff-A-Lympics games on each of the 2 discs for a total of maybe 5-6 new games. This to us is only a problem because we have both Scooby-Doo: Laff-A-Lympics 1 and Scooby-Doo: Laff-A-Lympics 2. But, I do have to say we BOTH completely enjoy watching this one as much as the others.
